io.github.goodees.ese.core

Class EventSourcingRuntimeBase<E extends EventSourcedEntity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.github.goodees.ese.core.EventSourcingRuntimeBase<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of entity this runtime handles
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DispatchingEventSourcingRuntime

    public abstract class EventSourcingRuntimeBase<E extends EventSourcedEntity>
extends Object
    Common logic for facade to speaking with entities. It instantiates the entities, recovers their state, manages their snapshots and invocation lifecycle. In order for recovery to work, the runtime needs EventLog to see the past events, and SnapshotStore for storing the snapshots. Entities will then need to be created with an EventStore that uses as is consistent with the EventLog.

    This class does not prescribe any specific execution and dispatching methods, this is left to subclasses.

    Lifecycles

    execute(String, Request) describes the lifecycle of single request execution. EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle describes the process of obtaining an initialized entity
    See Also:
    AsyncEventSourcingRuntime, SyncEventSourcingRuntime

    • Method Detail

      • instantiate

        protected abstract E instantiate(String entityId)
        Create a new uninitialized instance for given id. Serves for creating the entity with reference to the EventStore, correct identity (as required by EventSourcedEntity.EventSourcedEntity(String) and any other dependencies the entity might need to execute request, e. g. references to stateless ejbs, singletons, or this runtime. Runtime will restore the state from snapshot and journal afterwards.
        Parameters:
        entityId - the identity of the entity
        Returns:
        freshly instantiated entity object

      • dispose

        protected abstract void dispose(E entity)
        Perform clean up before removing an entity instance. This instance will no longer be used by the runtime, and if there are any steps to release its resources, they should be performed here. The method will be called by the processes within this package, it should not be invoked by runtime implementations itself.
        Parameters:
        entity - entity to dispose

      • getSnapshotStore

        protected abstract SnapshotStore getSnapshotStore()
        The SnapshotStore of this runtime. Snapshot store will be called to store a snapshot of an entity whenever method shouldStoreSnapshot(EventSourcedEntity, int) will return true.
        Returns:
        SnapshotStore of this runtime
        See Also:
        EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle, execute(String, Request)

      • getEventLog

        protected abstract EventLog getEventLog()
        Event log of this runtime. EventLog must be consistent with EventStore used for this runtime, so it can always return consistent set of events for an entity past specific version. It is used for recovery of an entity
        Returns:
        event log of this runtime
        See Also:
        EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle

      • execute

        public abstract <R extends Request<RS>,RS> CompletableFuture<RS> execute(String entityId,
                                                                         R request)
        Execute a request and return future result. This is the entry point for passing request to the entity and getting results from it.

        The runtime guarantees, that for given entityId, there is only one entity instance in the memory and it will only execute single request at time.

        When request is due for invocation, the runtime will perform following steps:

        1. Obtain an up-to-date instance, as described by EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle
        2. Pass the request to the instance. Subclasses of runtime define the contract between runtime and entity
        3. When call completes, EntityInvocationHandler.handleCompletion(String, EventSourcedEntity, Throwable) executes following logic:
          1. Entities invocation state will reflect successful or unsuccessful completion
          2. Method EventSourcedEntity.performPostInvocationActions(List, Throwable) is called to handle post invocation side effects}
          3. If the call completes exceptionally:
            1. When it was due to exception from storage processing, the entity will be removed from cache, so it would be recovered into fresh state on next request
            2. A runtime can optionally choose to retry the request, e. g. like implemented in DispatchingEventSourcingRuntime
            3. The returned future completes exceptionally
            Otherwise, the future completes successfully with the value returned by entity
          4. if runtime decides it should store snapshot of entity state, and entity provides a snapshot, it will be stored.

        We are returning completable future, so that it is easy to either chain the calls, or synchronously wait. However the clients should not call any mutation methods of the CompletableFuture, such as CompletableFuture.complete(Object). They may, and in current implementations will, throw an UnsupportedOperationException.

        Type Parameters:
        R - Type of request
        RS - Response type matching to the request
        Parameters:
        entityId - the identity of the entity to be called
        request - the request to perform
        Returns:
        CompletableFuture of the result.
        See Also:
        EntityInvocationHandler.Lifecycle

      • shouldStoreSnapshot

        protected abstract boolean shouldStoreSnapshot(E entity,
                                               int eventsSinceSnapshot)
        Decide if snapshot should be stored for given instance. The decision, and snapshot is done after request has been invoked.
        Parameters:
        entity - instance to snapshot
        eventsSinceSnapshot - events applied since last snapshot
        Returns:
        true if storage of snapshot should be attempted.

      • isInLatestKnownState

        protected boolean isInLatestKnownState(E entity)
        Compare current current instance to latest known state.
        Parameters:
        entity - the instance of an entity
        Returns:
        false if state of the instance is not the last known
